My name is Christopher Hench and I'm a PhD candidate at UC Berkeley in German Literature and Medieval Studies. I did my undergraduate work in German and Economics at Middlebury College and have a Master's in German and Scandinavian Studies from the University of Massachusetts, Amherst. I've also taught English on a Fulbright in LÃ¼beck, Germany. I'm interested in medieval epics and love poetry, economic thinking and literature, and the tools of the Digital Humanities.

While in Massachusetts, I worked at the DEFA Film Library helping with productions and subtitling films. I continue to enjoy subtitling films for both DEFA and the Goethe Institut. If you are in need of a German to English translation and subtitling, feel free to contact me!

I also love programming. I teach and consult on Python, web scraping and APIs, and NLP at Berkeley's D-Lab. While these different interests do intersect in my work, I also don't mind working on them separately!



What I'm working on now:

  • the sound of middle high german
  • intertextuality
  • poetic meter


D-Lab workshops I've taught:

  • Python Intensive
  • Introduction to Text Analysis in Python
  • Git Fundamentals
  • Programming Fundamentals (Bash)
